why: Changing positions regularly prevents stiffness and reduces pain by keeping tissues mobile and circulation flowing.

slides.title: Movement Variability
slides.content: Varying your positions and movements throughout the day prevents stiffness and reduces pain

slides.title: Why It Matters
slides.content: Staying in one position for too long can increase stiffness, reduce circulation, and amplify pain signals

slides.title: Practical Tips
slides.content: Set hourly reminders to change positions; alternate sitting and standing; take micro-breaks every 30 minutes

slides.title: Evidence Base
slides.content: Research shows that movement variability reduces musculoskeletal pain and improves function in office workers

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Rest is always best for pain. Fact: Gentle movement often reduces stiffness and pain.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: Set 3 phone alarms for position changes; do 2-minute movement breaks at each alarm
